title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 April 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:13 <jacktrick> has quit  
00:21 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
00:22 <jvdrean> has quit  
00:23 <sburjan`> has quit  
00:23 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
00:24 <sburjan`> has quit  
00:24 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
00:29 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
00:45 <jvdrean> has quit  
00:54 <CIA-74> Caleb James DeLisle master \* r8c6fd07 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/8c6fd079e6dfbd8407568607838801d55f8446d9 / (pom.xml xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-legacy/pom.xml): Looks like this is breaking the build. ...  
00:56 <@sdumitriu> cjd: The build is broken in so many places...  
00:56 <@sdumitriu> The deprecation day caused a lot of mess  
00:56 <@sdumitriu> I can't build anything  
00:57 <@cjd> I'd like to fix the ones I introduced if possible  
00:57 <@cjd> Granted I did make a big mess myself  
01:06 <CIA-74> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* radcc4f2 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/adcc4f2186eaf38a30eedf45233daed3296c93b5 / (2 files in 2 dirs): [misc] Fixed broken test - http://git.io/sKA8-A  
01:17 <Shaddox> has quit  
01:36 <@cjd> I'm going to restart the build, it looks like it pulled up an old version of commons-legacy because there's definitely a version of aspectj-rt  
01:58 <sburjan`> has quit  
03:34 <jamie\_\_xwiki> has quit  
04:16 <CIA-74> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r008b7e1 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/008b7e125640ab960f7595ad27e297243d52d381 / (7 files in 7 dirs): [legacy] Moved deprecated Util functions into the legacy-oldcore module - http://git.io/pHqt\_A  
04:16 <CIA-74> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r6bb610b https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/6bb610b2347324cb3c9d9bc50874e8939e76740e / xwiki-platform-core/pom.xml : [misc] Fixing the build some more... - http://git.io/WDBsfw  
04:29 <@cjd> are you sure that's needed? I was able to build platform ok locally, I think clirr is only applied to the legacy-oldcore  
04:42 <@sdumitriu> It failed for me  
04:42 <@cjd> that's odd, it seems to say clirr-skip is defined for oldcore  
04:43 <@cjd> perhaps we broke something and didn't add the proper aspect  
04:43 <@sdumitriu> Well, actually the errors I got were about removed aspects  
04:44 <@cjd> were you building with -Pci,legacy ?  
04:45 <@sdumitriu> Nope...  
04:45 <@cjd> hmm, I built without it and got no errors at all  
04:45 <@cjd> but legacy aspect isn't built by default anymore  
04:46 <@cjd> and I'm still trying to understand this maven-not-making-sense bug with aspectj-rt version  
04:52 <@sdumitriu> Really?  
04:52 <@sdumitriu> I see the version defined in xwiki-commons-legacy pom  
04:53 <@sdumitriu> Does platform-legacy inherit commons-legacy?  
04:53 <@cjd> yeah, what vmassol did appears to be right, before his patch it "worked", after his patch it broke and after I rolled it back it's still broken  
04:53 <@sdumitriu> I'll try to fix it  
04:53 <@cjd> I'll revert the revert since it doesn't make any sense anyway  
04:54 <@sdumitriu> OK, go ahead  
04:54 <@cjd> oop found it  
04:54 <@cjd> had to flush the repository, now it works  
04:56 <CIA-74> Caleb James DeLisle master \* r298b719 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/298b7192f3873fad26c35f43415ea97c67da62c4 / (pom.xml xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-legacy/pom.xml): Works ok after flushing the local repository. ...  
04:58 <@cjd> I guess the easiest thing to do is flush the repo on the agents to get the build back to at least failing for legit reasons  
05:05 <CIA-74> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r75d2abd https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/75d2abd64cb5e8856ce98d9a7aaac8151eba0f79 / (2 files in 2 dirs): [legacy] Moved deprecated Util functions into the legacy-oldcore module - http://git.io/G2iaeg  
06:52 <@sdumitriu> The build seems to work  
06:56 <@cjd> cool, MSHADE-103 seems to be killing rendering once again on the ci  
07:02 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
07:05 <Denis> has quit  
07:08 <@cjd> ahh looks like you got it, thanks  
07:13 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:26 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:32 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:33 <CIA-74> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r23d627f https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/23d627f8eb3bb090a232cd21947f1c58e991b627 / (3 files in 2 dirs): [misc] And even more build fixing... - http://git.io/0zvkjQ  
08:55 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
09:00 <vmassol> has quit  
09:03 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
09:10 <+sburjan`> hello sdumitriu. here you able to rebuild 3.5.1 ?  
09:10 <@sdumitriu> Nope  
09:10 <@sdumitriu> Been deprecating  
09:10 <+sburjan`> you too ? :)  
09:10 <@sdumitriu> But you should test on a snapshot  
09:10 <@sdumitriu> Didn't fix Oracle yet  
09:11 <+sburjan`> oh, ok  
09:11 <+sburjan`> are you working on monday ?  
09:11 <+sburjan`> because I don't .. so if you're planning to release monday, I should test the issue today  
09:49 <CIA-74> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r0cd7bb1 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/0cd7bb1b3558adf9efb5dd408cee10806de521d3 / (11 files in 5 dirs): [misc] Replaced deprecated method calls. ...  
09:50 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: latest 3.5-SNAPSHOT is from 25th April, right ?  
09:50 <+sburjan`> asking to be sure I'm using the right thing  
09:50 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
09:51 <+sburjan`> col, thanks  
09:51 <+sburjan`> \*cool  
09:52 <@sdumitriu> sburjan`: Actually I can commit the Oracle fix now  
09:52 <@sdumitriu> But you'll have to wait for the next build to test it  
09:52 <@sdumitriu> Meanwhile you can use the existing snapshot for PostgreSQL  
10:01 <+sburjan`> yes, just downloaded latest 3.5 snapshot  
10:01 <+sburjan`> testing postgres, then gonna wait for the Oracle fix  
10:04 <xipe\_\_> has quit  
10:07 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: I am having an issue with POstgres I had also yesterday  
10:13 <+sburjan`> let me delete the old stack and put the new one  
10:14 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <vmassol> good morning  
10:15 <vmassol> I'm going to send an email with the result of the deprecation dat  
10:15 <vmassol> day  
10:15 <vmassol> could you please reply to the thread with your stats?  
10:15 <vmassol> sdumitriu, mflorea  
10:15 <vmassol> cjd:  
10:15 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Almost done with another move  
10:15 <vmassol> I'll write a blog post too with the total figure  
10:15 <+mflorea> no stats on my side..  
10:15 <vmassol> ok  
10:16 <vmassol> mflorea: I see you've moved deprecated stuff no?  
10:16 <+mflorea> I only remove/replaced deprecated calls  
10:16 <vmassol> this is what I have mflorea:  
10:16 <vmassol> Deprecated calls fixed: 5  
10:16 <vmassol> Deprecated APIs moved: 2  
10:16 <vmassol> Legacy modules added: 1  
10:17 <vmassol> 3 metrics  
10:17 <vmassol> if you've fixed deprecated calls that's metric #1  
10:17 <+mflorea> oh, ok  
10:17 <vmassol> thomas has also replied to teh thread  
10:17 <+mflorea> I'll reply then with #1  
10:17 <vmassol> cool  
10:17 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu, Denis: updated XWIKI-7771  
10:23 <jvdrean> has quit  
10:42 <vmassol> sdumitriu: what's up with the 3.5.1 release?  
10:42 <@sdumitriu> Sorin is doing a final testing today  
10:42 <vmassol> sdumitriu: so everything is fixed?  
10:43 <@sdumitriu> There's still XWIKI-7771 and XWIKI-7770  
10:43 <vmassol> blockers for 3.5.1?  
10:43 <vmassol> people are getting antsy about the 3.5.1 release  
10:44 <vmassol> they look like blockers  
10:44 <vmassol> are you working on them?  
10:44 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
10:44 <vmassol> it's taking very long to fix. Is it complex? or are you lacking tests?  
10:45 <vmassol> from the outside it looks like one step forward, one step backward  
10:46 <vmassol> does it mean we won't be able to release this week?  
10:47 <+sburjan`> I won't be working monday, so if you want to test on Monday, someone else will have to do it  
10:47 <vmassol> ah yes so we really need to release today  
10:47 <vmassol> since next monday/tuesday is off in romania  
10:47 <+sburjan`> or Tuesday  
10:47 <+sburjan`> no, I'm gonna work on Tuesday  
10:48 <vmassol> (tuesday is off too herein France and a lot of people won't work on monday)  
10:48 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: It's long to test  
10:48 <@sdumitriu> Since each change requires dropping the database, creating the database, starting the old version, adding content, compiling the new version, starting the new version, testing  
10:49 <vmassol> ok  
10:49 <vmassol> this has been going on for a long time though, several weeks, anyway please do your max to get it released this week  
10:49 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:50 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
10:58 <CIA-74> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* ra523800 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/a523800958a0f84f63856e8a5752bcde51fbd4ea / (6 files in 2 dirs): [cleanup] Improved codestyle/checkstyle - http://git.io/zNUNrQ  
10:58 <CIA-74> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r7c2f4d9 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/7c2f4d91bc99a93f8e5dce3fb9c12c76ac46434b / (12 files in 4 dirs): XWIKI-7772: Move the old AutoTag plugin to its own module ...  
10:58 <CIA-74> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r0c7aab6 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/0c7aab66c949d4cdbacaaa15bb1e2c5008cf0f6c / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/store/migration/hibernate/R35101XWIKI7645DataMigration.java : XWIKI-7770: Failing migration from 3.5 to 3.5.1 on Oracle ...  
10:59 <CIA-74> Sergiu Dumitriu stable-4.0.x \* r3b47b41 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/3b47b414e3ef214cdf686498a17b439280dbbfab / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/store/migration/hibernate/R35101XWIKI7645DataMigration.java : XWIKI-7770: Failing migration from 3.5 to 3.5.1 on Oracle ...  
10:59 <CIA-74> Sergiu Dumitriu stable-3.5.x \* rf05b64e https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/f05b64e1328f9374d78be276a0103face02c7b6e / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/store/migration/hibernate/R35101XWIKI7645DataMigration.java : XWIKI-7770: Failing migration from 3.5 to 3.5.1 on Oracle ...  
11:00 <@sdumitriu> sburjan`: Committed, wait for the build (for Oracle)  
11:00 <@sdumitriu> I'll look at Postgres after some sleep  
11:03 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: ok, have a good sleep. Hope I'll be there by the time you wake up  
11:10 <vmassol> sdumitriu: haven't checked but have you thought about adding deps for the 2 new modules in XE/web.xml?  
11:11 <@sdumitriu> Which ones?  
11:11 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <@sdumitriu> autotag plugin?  
11:11 <vmassol> yes those  
11:11 <@sdumitriu> We don't use that  
11:11 <@sdumitriu> It's used by reader and probably curriki  
11:11 <vmassol> well they were bundled in our platform  
11:11 <vmassol> so people could have used them  
11:12 <vmassol> so we need a vote probably to remove them maybe  
11:12 <@sdumitriu> I'd rather not include it, since it's deprecated API  
11:12 <vmassol> then we need to decide if we keep them in platform or retired?  
11:12 <vmassol> if it's depracted then good  
11:12 <vmassol> we can move diretly to legacy  
11:12 <@sdumitriu> Yes, that's a valid decision, but we'll wait some more until we retire it completely  
11:12 <vmassol> legacy seems good then  
11:13 <vmassol> that should be voted too I think though  
11:13 <@sdumitriu> OK, but I have to go to sleep now  
11:13 <@sdumitriu> It's 5AM  
11:13 <@sdumitriu> Good night  
11:13 <vmassol> ok and please focus on XE 3.5.1 release :)  
11:13 <vmassol> I can handle that vote and move  
11:13 <@sdumitriu> Well, good day to you  
11:13 <@sdumitriu> Good night to me :)  
11:13 <vmassol> and nn to you  
11:43 <+mflorea> vmassol: for the office importer, should I keep the office/office-importer hierarchy under legacy, or put directly xwiki-platform-legacy-office-importer ?  
11:44 <vmassol> re legacy modules  
11:44 <vmassol> see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices#HDeprecationRules  
11:44 <vmassol> third rule  
11:44 <vmassol> ah no  
11:44 <vmassol> first rule  
11:44 <vmassol> :)  
11:45 <vmassol> (see the link for the rationale)  
11:45 <+mflorea> we already have 1 in platform  
11:45 <vmassol> http://markmail.org/thread/cljbqwbrrmunlmar  
11:45 <vmassol> wdym?  
11:45 <+mflorea> we have xwiki-platform-legacy  
11:45 <vmassol> yes so?  
11:45 <+mflorea> I'm asking about the structure inside  
11:45 <vmassol> that's rule 3  
11:46 <vmassol> let me make it more explicit  
11:46 <+mflorea> rule 3 doesn't say if I should add all parents  
11:46 <vmassol> I don't understand  
11:47 <vmassol> ah yes  
11:47 <vmassol> got it  
11:47 <+mflorea> in my case, xwiki-platform-legacy-office/xwiki-platform-legacy-office-importer vs. /xwiki-platform-legacy-office-importer directly  
11:47 <vmassol> we haven't define this  
11:47 <vmassol> but  
11:47 <vmassol> IMO you only add hiearchy if you have 2 or more  
11:47 <vmassol> (children)  
11:47 <+mflorea> in legacy  
11:47 <vmassol> yep  
11:48 <vmassol> this is what I did for commons legacy  
11:48 <vmassol> for commons compnent in legacy I mean  
11:48 <+mflorea> ok so for the moment I'll add legacy-office-importer in legacy and will add the parent in the future if we created other office legacy module  
11:48 <vmassol> so that would be the same rule as for non legacy bazsically  
11:48 <vmassol> yep  
11:48 <+mflorea> ok  
11:48 <+mflorea> thanks  
11:49 <vmassol> mflorea: re the wysiwyg plugin you moved to retired yesterday, was there a vote about it?  
11:49 <vmassol> because that violates our new deprecation/legacy rules  
11:49 <vmassol> (if there was no vote)  
11:51 <vmassol> (since it's non-"internal" code that was removed and not avail as legacy)  
11:51 <+mflorea> no, I don't think it violates the rules because that code (the client side) was not bundled in XE since a long time  
11:51 <vmassol> and?  
11:51 <vmassol> hmm  
11:51 <vmassol> so we can remove anything in platform  
11:51 <vmassol> provided it's not bundled in the XE distrib?  
11:51 <vmassol> it was distributed  
11:51 <+mflorea> not remove, move  
11:51 <vmassol> as maven artifact  
11:52 <vmassol> I don't agree with this  
11:52 <vmassol> for ex  
11:52 <+mflorea> the artifact wasn't usable  
11:52 <+mflorea> it's a GWT jar  
11:52 <vmassol> I still think it violates  
11:52 <vmassol> the rule  
11:52 <vmassol> because you took a unilateral decision  
11:53 <vmassol> I really want us to be careful re removal of stuff from now on  
11:53 <vmassol> this is why there's this rule now  
11:53 <+mflorea> there was a vote a long time ago to don't include this plugin in the WYSIWYG - i.e. to not compile it in the editor code  
11:53 <vmassol> yes  
11:53 <vmassol> i still think we need to be more careful and it doesn't cost much  
11:53 <+mflorea> so it's live having a module in platform that is not used and we move it to retired, anyone can stil use it from retired  
11:53 <vmassol> well then  
11:54 <vmassol> why do we have thise rules?  
11:54 <vmassol> :)  
11:54 <vmassol> we can move whatever we want to retired  
11:54 <vmassol> and tell people to use it from there  
11:54 <vmassol> btw  
11:54 <vmassol> you need to add this to the RN  
11:54 <+mflorea> why?  
11:54 <+mflorea> :)  
11:54 <vmassol> becasue it's a breakage  
11:54 <vmassol> you have absolutely no clue  
11:55 <vmassol> if someone was using it or not  
11:55 <vmassol> not talking runtime but compiling it  
11:55 <vmassol> dev breakage if you prefer  
11:57 <vmassol> just to let the dev who might be using it where it's now located  
11:57 <vmassol> s/using it/using it know/  
11:57 <+mflorea> ok  
11:59 <vmassol> I'd really like that we become a real stable platform so IMO we need to be extra clean/careful in our removals. I know this one is probably not an issue and is much less an issue than other stuff but being real careful is a general habit we need to acquire.  
12:01 <vmassol> actually what Anca suggested is a good idea I think  
12:01 <vmassol> ie.  
12:01 <vmassol> we create a BackwardComapitiblityBreakage xclass  
12:01 <vmassol> and add as many xobjects of it as we have brekaages in our RN pages  
12:02 <vmassol> and then on our downlage page (for ex) allow a user to list all breakages from his version to the version he wishes to upgrade to  
12:02 <vmassol> we'll need a version xproperty too with an order algo  
12:03 <vmassol> we might have it already in the extension module  
12:03 <vmassol> (she didn't really suggest this but this my answer to her request to be able to see all breakages when upgrading)  
12:04 <vmassol> that reminds me of a discussion I had with fabio  
12:04 <vmassol> telling him we should have a Release Application  
12:04 <vmassol> that we use on xwiki.org and that we makes available on e.x.o  
12:05 <vmassol> … another 20% time project… ;)  
12:14 <jvdrean> has quit  
12:20 <vmassol> mflorea: btw I'm wondering if we should also add in the RN when we rename, move or split a module  
12:21 <vmassol> well we have to decide how much we want to take care of developers  
12:21 <vmassol> ie the effort we spend there  
12:23 <CIA-74> tmortagne master \* r010d43a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/010d43a32d498128cfaac5e75f1d06a0be4d0568 / (2 files in 2 dirs): Add missing virtual packages - http://git.io/YVgsaA  
12:24 <+mflorea> might be useful, but mixing user stuff with developers stuff is risky. Another think to take into account is that we release the platform (+rendering, commons) and the release notes are, at least officially, for XE, the distribution, so for someone looking for changes in XE, is is confusing to see changes in the platform that don't affect XE  
12:24 <vmassol> yeah we're not very clean for release notes on this  
12:24 <vmassol> we're releasig comons, rendernig, platform and xe  
12:24 <vmassol> yet our RN title is XE  
12:24 <+mflorea> yes  
12:24 <+mflorea> yep  
12:25 <CIA-74> tmortagne master \* r6fe4459 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/6fe4459e87fd313d5a8c6caed35d699fa36121b9 / xwiki-rendering-legacy/xwiki-rendering-legacy-api/pom.xml : Add missing virtual packages - http://git.io/EOUwtg  
12:25 <vmassol> we should find a name for the whole stuff  
12:25 <vmassol> Ecosystem 4.0  
12:25 <vmassol> that's too broad  
12:25 <vmassol> it's what the xwiki dev team codes/support  
12:25 <vmassol> well XE is good shortcut  
12:26 <+tmortagne> XWiki 4.0  
12:26 <vmassol> since it depends on all  
12:26 <vmassol> yeah XWiki 4.0 is good actually  
12:26 <vmassol> and inside we can have sections for the various top level repos  
12:27 <vmassol> or aggregate them  
12:27 <vmassol> we need aggaregation actually  
12:27 <vmassol> since otherwise the RN will become very technical  
12:28 <vmassol> we can separate in the section called "All issues fixed"  
12:28 <vmassol> with a link to jira for each project  
12:28 <vmassol> the rest is just high level text to explain in english language the new stuff  
12:29 <qwebirc98344> has joined #xwiki  
12:29 <qwebirc98344> Hello all!  
12:30 <qwebirc98344> Does someone know if LibreOffice in its 3.5 version is supported by the Office plugin, or should I go with the 3.4 release?  
12:30 <vmassol> try it and let us know! :)  
12:31 <vmassol> my guess is that it'll work  
12:32 <qwebirc98344> Hehe, fortunatly I'm still at test phase. Is there an official channel to give a feedback or is editing the Office import plugin will suffice?  
12:33 <vmassol> cjd: hi, I'll need your deprecation day stats  
12:33 <vmassol> qwebirc98344: mailing list is best  
12:33 <vmassol> or the wiki  
12:33 <+tmortagne> that or directly a jira issue if it does not work
